description.narrative: Empowering women in participation in public administration and socio-economic life

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development

description.narrative:
Indicator 1.1. Share of innovative policies, models and tools on the advancement of women in public service and in sectors of economy that were tested and approved by national partner for scaling up (%)
Indicator 1.2. Draft legislative documents on gender equality, women empowerment that are in line with international standards are available.
Indicator 1.3. Share of participants from Women’s Committee, MELR, State Statistics Committee, khokimiyats who apply at their work knowledge and skills gained through trainings, conferences, workshops on gender equality and women empowerment
Indicator 1.4. Number of practical and methodological manuals on women empowerment and gender statistics prepared by the project.

comment.narrative:
1.1Support, assistance to analysis / monitoring of the activities of 2 Centers for the Rehabilitation and Adaptation of Victims of Violence and the Prevention of Suicides. 1.2.Collection of data and assessment of existing gaps and barriers in access to justice services for women and girls. 1.3. Designing and supporting the provision of key services in selected pilot locations, including ProBono legal aid / legal aid, courts and informal justice mechanisms. 1.4. Support of Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the creation of One Pilot Center in the regions of Uzbekistan for girls/young women to expand their rights and opportunities in the field of STEM. 1.5.Support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the development of a mobile application for mobile phones to raise public awareness on gender, gender based violence, healthcare of women and information on existing services for victims of GBV. 1.6.Organize the international conference “Empowering women in public administration, as well as in the field of STEM” to promote high-level gender equality. 1.7. Development of promo materials to raise public awareness on gender issues, women in justice and the prevention of harassment and violence against women. 1.8. Organization of trainings, round tables on gender issues, STEM, gender expertise of legislation and gender-based violence, discussions with women's NGOs and legal experts on gender-based violence.
2.1. Assistance in the development of a draft methodology for conducting gender-legal expertise of national legislation. 2.2. Assistance to develop amendments to the legislation in connection with the adopted Laws “ On protection of women from harassment and violence” and “On guarantees of equal rights and equal opportunities for men and women”. 2.3. Assistance to the conducting Gender expertise of national legislation based on the draft methodology on conducting gender expertise. 2.4. Preparation of the analytical report “Crimes committed by women: causes and ways of elimination”. 2.5. Preparation of an analytical report statistics on domestic violence, dis-aggregated by age and relationship between victim and perpetrator. 2.6. Preparation of an analytical report according to the empowerment of women in public administration, as well as in the field of STEM
3.1 Provide support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in collecting and maintaining statistics on harassment and violence against women. 3.2.Support for updating the government portal gender.stat.uz and releasing gender-disaggregated data across the sector for decision making, regulatory impact assessment, strategic planning, institutional development, and progress monitoring. 3.3. Support Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in organizing interactive online courses to provide online training for women's NGOs and NGOs working with violence, STEM. 3.4.Design and implement legal empowerment initiatives such as legal literacy programs through legal assistants and self-help groups. 3.5.Support to Ministry for supporting Mahalla and Family in the creation of a Media Center for working with the media. 3.6. Organization of study tours to a foreign countries in order to exchange experiences on the effective work of gender equality, temporary special measures, social inclusive services for women in rural areas. 3.7. To teach developers of legislation to conduct gender expertise of legislation, to inculcate skills for conducting gender expertise.

1.1. As a technical support 15 laptops, one projector procured and provided to shelter workers. Also, 21 tablets were provided to women inspectors of shelters of Ministry of Internal Affairs to streamline interaction with victims of GBV. Also, 550 winter clothing for victims of violence in shelters and people with disabilities. Trainings to employees from 14 regional shelters was provided on medical support, legal and psychological support to victims of GBV, as well as the use of e-journal on collecting statistics of GVB cases. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020; OL from Ministry of Mahalla and Family Support. 1.2. An e-Journal was developed to help national counterpart to maintain statistics of domestic violence. The software helps to collect and analyze gender statistics from 197 shelters. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020; 1.3. an online mobile clinic to provide legal and psychological consultations for women and people with disabilities (with the help of a sign translation) on TV (Uzreport), radio, social networks (Telegram - Azizam channel). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.4. The joint project provided technical support to the opening of a STEM center in Tashkent region as part of a new project to improve computer literacy of people with disabilities (deaf and hearing impaired girls and youth). The project is implemented jointly with a local NGO “Mehr Kuzda”. Also, the draft Presidential Resolution “On measures to empower girls and women in the development of exact and technological sciences (STEM)" has been developed; Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.5. A mobile app " NAJOT" was developed. The app provides access for women and girls in remote regions of Uzbekistan to information on issues such as hygiene during a pandemic, social issues in families, the promotion of women, gender equality, women's rights and opportunities, the rights of victims of violence, measures of legal protection for victims of violence. A mobile app “UZNTT” was developed. The app converts speech into sign language (surdo translation) for people with hearing disabilities. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.6. An international scientific and practical conference “Ideas and initiatives of young women in the development of science, education and the digital economy” was conducted. The Conference was dedicated to the discussion and development of recommendations in the field of protecting the rights and interests of women, as well as ensuring gender equality in the country based on scientifically sound proposals (more than 150 participants, including 10 foreign experts from the USA, Italy, India and Sweden). An international forum "Raising the legal culture of women is an important factor in the development of the country", dedicated to the discussion of new mechanisms for the effective protection of women, role of law enforcement officers in protecting the rights and interests of women, increasing the socio-political activity of women, cooperation between state and public organizations to address family issues (more than 400 participants). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.7. Three video clips, 2 brochures, 3 flyers were prepared and distributed at drugstores. These promo materials were posted on social media in order to raise public awareness on women empowerment and GBV during the lockdown period. Also, as part of a 16-day campaign against gender-based violence the joint project initiated, implemented and conducted the following projects and events: - A webinar on “Effective assistance to the victims of domestic violence: the experience of Sweden” with the participation of Swedish experts for employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of Higher Education, the Ministry of Health, the Academy of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Bar Association, and employees of the Republican Center for Rehabilitation; - An online mobile clinic to provide legal and psychological consultations for women and people with disabilities (with the help of a sign translation) on TV (Uzreport), radio, social networks (Telegram - Azizam channel); - Launch of a mobile application "Najot” to support the protection of rights of GBV victims and survivors and provision of timely assistance and access to information; - Launch of a “positive masculinity” campaign to raise awareness of gender-based violence among the general public: videos featuring religious leaders, publication and distribution of booklets, brochures and leaflets containing information on gender-based violence and women's rights; - A national contest "Gender Equality Activist" with the participation of representatives of ministries, departments, non-governmental organizations and journalists, who achieved high results in the field of gender equality at the end of the year, came up with initiatives for the development of society, defended the rights of women and performed relevant tasks in their field. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 1.8. A series of trainings have been conducted on GBV prevention with the participation of international experts for employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and its Academy, Ministry of Higher Education, Ministry of Health, Association of Lawyers, Republican Center for Rehabilitation and 197 women shelters, as well as representatives of mahallas of all levels (over 1,500 people). An international scientific and practical conference “Ideas and initiatives of young women in the development of science, education and the digital economy” was conducted. The Conference was dedicated to the discussion and development of recommendations in the field of protecting the rights and interests of women, as well as ensuring gender equality in the country based on scientifically sound proposals (more than 150 participants, including 10 foreign experts from the USA, Italy, India and Sweden). Also, series of trainings, dedicated to the improvement of research and publishing skills of women scholars (over 50 women scholars and university professors) Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.1. The Governmental Resolution “On Conducting Gender-Legal Expertise of Acts and Their Projects” approved on March 30, 2020 by #192. Evidence: https://lex.uz/ru/docs/4777291 2.2. Draft amendments to two gender-laws on GBV and equal rights and opportunities for women and men were developed and submitted to national counterpart. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.3. The methodology for gender legal expertise of national legislation has been prepared. The Gender-legal examination of Labor Code, Criminal Code, and Civil Code has been conducted. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.4. The analytical report crimes committed by women: causes, ways of elimination was prepared. Analytical paper “ON causes and consequences of divorces among women in Uzbekistan” was prepared and submitted to national partner. The findings of analytical paper are to be served as a basis for a draft law “On Divorces” in 2021. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 2.5. The analytical report on domestic violence, disaggregated by age and relationship between victim and perpetrator was prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020 2.6. The analysis of the best foreign practice and experience on empowering women in STEM was prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.1. An e-Journal was developed to help national counterpart to maintain statistics of domestic violence. The software helps to collect and analyze gender statistics from 197 shelters. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.2. Not implemented due to the COVID-19 related lockdown. 3.3. Eight video lessons on gender equality, women empowerment, harassment, gender based violence, women in justice was prepared and uploaded to the website of the Gender Commission of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Also, three paintings on women empowerment were prepared and submitted to National Partner in order to replicate them in the building in 2021 within street art concept. 3.4. The practical guideline for the provision of primary care (medical, psychological, social and legal assistance) to victims of violence in shelters has been prepared. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.5. The Media Center was established with the support from the UNDP. Relevant specialists were attracted (editor, PR specialist, designer, translator, cameramen and other technical support staff). A laptop and a projector provided to the Media Center. Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020. 3.6. Not implemented due to the COVID-19 related lockdown. 3.7. A series of trainings were conducted with the participation of international experts on gender expertise of normative legal acts and draft laws for representatives of both chambers of the Parliament (more than 150 participants took part in the training). Evidence: Project Board Meeting as of December 4, 2020.

1.1. 40% share of innovative policies, models and tools on the advancement of women in public service and in sectors of economy that were tested and approved by national partner for scaling up 1.2. At least 1 draft legislative document on gender equality, women empowerment in line with international standards is available. 1.3. At least 10% share of participants from Women’s Committee, MELR, State Statistics Committee, khokimiyats apply at their work knowledge and skills gained through trainings, conferences, workshops on gender equality and women empowerment 1.4. At least 1 practical and methodological manual on women empowerment and gender statistics is prepared by the project.

1.1. On track On 21 May 2018 the first SDG Policy Dialogue in Uzbekistan on topic "Towards 2030: SDG Policy Dialogue "Participation of Women in Public Administration in the Context of Economic, Social and Institutional transformations" was held as an opportunity for politicians, policy-makers and others to share thoughts, experiences and ideas to work on solutions to the advancement of women in public service and in sectors of economy. Experts and specialists of leading international organizations in Uzbekistan (UNFPA, ILO, OSCE, etc.), representatives of parliaments, governments, ministries and departments, women's organizations, as well as heads of the diplomatic corps accredited in Uzbekistan discussed the issues of participation of women in public administration in Uzbekistan. The recommendations of SDG Policy Dialogue used to prepare policy document "On the participation of women in public administration and society affairs" of the government. 1.2. On track The Project had formed UN Task Force - group of experts from UN, UNFPA, UNICEF,ILO and other UN Agencies in Uzbekistan to prepare comments and recommendations to Draft Law "On prevention of Domestic Violence". As a result, more than 100 recommendations of members of Task Force were studied and more than 90 recommendations were adopted into Draft Law. Draft Law, updated based on recommendations of UN Task Force submitted to Women's Committee of Uzbekistan and Ministry of Justice of Uzbekistan. It is planned that the Law will be finalized and adopted by Parliament in 2019. 1.3. On track. The Project organized series of trainings for women employees of Women's Committee of Uzbekistan, MELR, khokimiyats. On international Conference on the topic of "The Role of Women in Democratic Renewal and Modernization of the Country: Best International Practice and Experience of Uzbekistan" on 7 November, 2018 in Tashkent, Uzbekistan participated all representatives of Women's Committee of Uzbekistan (20 women) and Heads of regional branches (14 women). Trainings on leadership for women innovators also participated by 10 employees of Tashkent city and Tashkent regional branches of WCU. The Project developed training programs and modules on best policies, strategies and actions to support labour migrants, as well as in tackling issues of migrants for 4 target groups: a) civil servants; b) leaders and community representatives; c) labor migrants; d) family members of migrant workers in the Fergana Valley. 17 trainings were conducted in Tashkent, Fergana, Andijan, Namangan regions, within which 293 people (193 women) were trained out of , including: 104 (40 women) - civil servants, 91 women- specialists of Women's Committee of Uzbekistan in makhallas, 52 (35 women) - labor migrants, 46 (32 women) - members of migrant families. Brainstorming on the potential of digital technologies in improving the quality of public services for labour migrants was held on October 16, 2018 at the Innovations Lab. of the Ministry of Innovation Development. (17 women, 18 men) Issues raised by participants were addressed to the representatives of Governmental Agencies and ministries. Recommendations and ideas obtained during the discussion were used while developing Mob.App requirements document. 4 pilot centers in 3 regions of Fergana Valley started their operations at the regional Bureaus of the Agency for external labour migration where 15 consultants (12 women) provide legal, psychological and training services for outgoing, returning labour migrants and their family members A team of experts (4 women, 2 men) finalized the first draft of the report on field survey, which was conducted in pilot regions with focus on internal and external labour migration processes and connection with PVE. It was submitted to UNDP GGU cluster to receive feedback. Recommendations and comments were taken into account and the second draft report will be submitted by February 2019. 1.4. On Track The Project developed a series of analytical materials and recommendations for further improvement of Centers for Social Adaptation and Suicide Prevention and submitted to the Women's Committee of Uzbekistan and Ministry of Justice of Republic of Uzbekistan. The Project also prepared the following draft documents in accordance with international standards: Charter of the Center; Functional duties of the director, psychologist, lawyer, accountant; Contract for the provision of services; Rules of the Center; Code of Professional and Ethical Conduct for Center staff; Forms of statistical, financial and annual report, etc. Moreover, the mechanism, on the basis of the recommendations of CEDAW for collecting gender-disaggregated statistics in the country was developed by the Project in cooperation with the State Statistics Committee. The minimum set of UN gender indicators, including 52 indicators, has been entered into the statistics of Uzbekistan. The design and content of the official website www.gender.stat.uz has been completely updated, gender-disaggregated statistics have been added, as well as a separate section of the UN Minimum Gender Indicators. The introduction of such statistics will help to find out the situation not only of the total population, but also of women individually for the implementation of reforms targeting women. The presentation of the updated website planned to be held in February 2019 During the year the Project focused on mainstreaming and adoption of law on prevention of domestic violence that could provide to improve the national legislation and mechanisms on human rights protection and fulfilments of international human rights obligations. In order to achieve this goal the Project provided constant methodological and expert support for core improvement of the first draft Law on prevention of domestic violence through involvement of all UN Agencies, experts in development of recommendations and comments based on best international experience, including policy paper on drafting the legislation on domestic violence. The Draft Law on prevention of domestic violence which was updated with recommendations of international agencies is a product of a long joint work of respective national partners (Ministry of Justice and WCU) and UN Agencies in Uzbekistan. The law promotes such transformative goals as regulating actions aimed at the prevention of domestic violence, of bodies and institutions directly involved in the prevention of domestic violence and providing guarantees of legal and social protection for victims from such violence. The Draft Law includes following main provisions: - Clear definition of domestic violence, as well as types of domestic violence and a common understanding among all relevant institutions on gender-based violence against women; - Restriction of any acts towards victims of domestic violence and the introduction of new mechanism - "Protection order", a document providing state protection to a victim of domestic violence and providing legal measures to the person who committed domestic violence; - Introduction of relevant tools and mechanisms for responsible parties, government agencies, non-governmental organizations on prevention of domestic violence and protection from any types of such violence. It is planned that the Law will be finalized and adopted by Parliament in 2019. One shelter was launched with both technical and legal support of the Project and amendments were made to 130 shelters’ charters in line with international standards. Services of shelters consist of assisting any women in both urban and rural areas with anonymous urgent medical, psychological, social, pedagogical, legal and other aid including those facing family problems and domestic violence. Moreover, the Project in close cooperation with State Statistics Committee started elaboration of the first draft methodology mechanisms, on the basis of the recommendations of CEDAW for collecting gender-disaggregated statistics in the country. The minimum set of UN gender indicators, including 52 indicators, has been entered into the statistics of Uzbekistan. The design and content of the official website www.gender.stat.uz has been completely updated, gender-disaggregated statistics have been added, as well as a separate section of the UN Minimum Gender Indicators. The introduction of such statistics will help to find out the situation not only of the total population, but also of women individually for the implementation of reforms targeting women. The presentation of the updated website planned to be held on February,2019. Also the Project lunched a strategic plan to empower women to participate in public administration. During consultations with the Women's Committee of Uzbekistan and Legislative Branch of Oliy Majlis of Uzbekistan, it was decided to start from analyzing the current situation of women in public administration and consequences for low presentation of women in public administration in Uzbekistan. For the first time SDG Policy Dialogues were designed to create a platform for discussion, sharing views and insights on emerging trends, and more importantly to explore recommendations on possible solutions on the way towards Agenda 2030. These events brought together government representatives, experts, NGOs and diplomatic community to share ideas and insights for achieving the SDGs and to encourage them to contribute to mainstreaming the Sustainable Development Goals. On May 21, 2018 - SDG Policy Dialogue "Participation of women in public administration in the context of economic, social and institutional transformations" to facilitate discussions on key findings and results of the policy paper "Women's Participation in Public Administration to Accelerate Economic, Social and Institutional Transformations”. The paper shows that advancing gender equality as not only an end in itself, but also as catalytic in development and the investments made in women and girls are great multipliers of development progress. Main recommendations of this policy paper were : • Focus on improving the quality of education; • Increase the enrollment of higher education to 25% and transform the structure of higher education; • Form a system of short-term courses for women aged 35-40. Transformation of political parties, courts, the media and science into effective social elevators to promote women in public administration: • Develop clear conditions and mechanisms for promoting women to government through political parties, the media, courts, scientific institutions; • To expand the practice of appointing women heads of the media (editors-in-chief), judges and academicians to senior government posts; • create special women's units in the Ministry of the Interior and women's road patrol / tourist services (Mexico City example). Help was prepared a little earlier. Today this initiative has already been successfully implemented in our country. • The problem is not in the low percentage of women entrepreneurs, the problem in the effectiveness of social lifts from small businesses to public administration; • Transformation of the existing business model from large + small to large + medium + small businesses can solve the problem • A new model of enterprises - social elevators to promote women in public administration. The recommendations of SDG Policy Dialogue used to prepare policy document "On the participation of women in public administration and society affairs" of the government.

1.1. UNDP WEP project facilitated the creation of pilot Women’s rehabilitation Centers/shelters (197 countrywide). Moreover, Legal clinics for Rural women were established in 4 regions: Kashkadarya, Surkhandarya, Khorezm, Karakalpakstan to provide legal services and support to women experiencing violence and other social issues. 1.2. UNDP WEP project facilitated a UN Taskforce and provided evidence-based comments and recommendations to facilitate the drafting of two gender-related laws “On guarantees of equal rights and opportunities for women and men” and Law “On protection of women from gender-based violence”, which were enacted in 2019 1.3. To promote knowledge sharing and awareness raising on GBV issues, UNDP has organized more than 10 trainings and round tables. More than 150 people (80 % are women) attended our capacity building trainings on leadership, gender-legal expertise, to gain skills to work with victims of violence and GBV. In addition, 50 women-officers of Ministry of Internal Affairs were trained to gain skills to work with victims of violence. Training on gender-legal expertise in regard of compliance of local legislation on women empowerment with the best international standards was carried out for the members of Parliament, candidates to deputy of Legislative Chamber for the first time in Uzbekistan. For the first time in Uzbekistan, on December 2, 2019, a dialogue “Step towards an equal world: Prevent. Protect. Empower” dedicated to the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women (25th of November) was held with participation of high-level representatives of government. 1.4. Knowledge materials, infographics on GBV and PSA on prevention of violence were produced and disseminated widely.The following knowledge products were developed and circulated among national partners: - Manual for future women leaders. - Concept note and target recommendations on organizing the activities of mobile legal clinics. - Dozens of study materials and manuals on gender-based issues were developed and shared as part of organized training and workshops. - 6 promotional and tutorial videos on gender discrimination, violence against women were developed and widely circulated on media to raise public awareness on gender-based issues.
